user_input: How does EMS-A enhance the cancellation process for travel agencies?
reference_contexts:
High-level Business Need / Market Problems

What is the customer's high-level business need or market problem? (What are the drivers? Who exactly (persona) is affected by the problem? What is customer’s problem? Why is this a problem? How often do they face the problem? How much does the problem cost to customer? How does customer solve the problem today? Consequences of not solving the problem? What data supports/invalidates our assumptions and beliefs about problem?​) 

This capability will enable user to cancel air exchanged item and also corresponding ancillaries like: seat, bags and all other EMD-A items. Previously SabreMosaic cancel operation was limited to cancel initial air order and corresponding EMD-As, but now regardless of number of exchanges we will be able to cancel recent air exchanged order_item and also EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, that are not automatically canceled by PSS.

When an OrderItem is exchanged, and then ultimately refunded, the applicable refundability rules from the Original itinerary apply.

If the  refundability of the exchange is more restrictive (higher penalty, rules) , the rules that apply to the exchange apply in the case of a cancelation

 Objectives for a Successful Solution 

What objectives does the customer need to accomplish? (What is the customer’s goal(s)?)

The most restrictive of the refundability rules apply when a changed order item/order is subsequently canceled

 Business Value  

What is the measurable benefit delivered? (What is the value of what we’re doing? What benefits user gets while using solution? How customer describes value? What is the value for customer? How the solution address the problem?​ Why do we decided to solve the problem?​ What is unique about our value proposition? How does it differentiate from existing solutions? Does this uniqueness matter to customers?)

Will protect the airline from leakage by rule bypassing
reference: EMS-A enables users to cancel air exchanged items and corresponding ancillaries like seats and bags, addressing the previous limitations of SabreMosaic's cancel operation. This capability allows for the cancellation of recent air exchanged order items and EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, which were not automatically canceled by PSS.

user_input: How does Wolverine Technology support the goals of the SabreMosaic platform?
reference_contexts:
What Success Looks Like

What conditions must be met?  (What are the verifiable results? How do you define success of this capability?​ How to measure success?​ How customer measure success?​ How will it impact customer?​ What quantitative metrics can be used to measure value proposition?​)   

The most restrictive of the refundability rules apply when a changed order item/order is subsequently canceled



Useful links:

1. Capability Document: Wolverine Technology :: sabresonic/FEA97211 - Order Change - Cancel after exchange

2. Mural for FEA97211

3. SabreMosaic [Wolverine] - Capability Tracking (2023-2025) | [WS2] FEA97211 Cancel after exchange | Microsoft Teams

Program OKRs relations

Which OKRs are being supported by this capability?​

Prove SabreMosaic is a viable technology platform for beyond LCC (SabreSonic)

How this capability supports Program goals and key results?

This will show that the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic is possible.

Hypothesis to be validated 

1. Enter data here if applicable

Is / Is not in Scope

In Scope Out of Scope applying the original refundability rules in case an exchange is ultimately refunded exchange with refund applying the most restrictive refundability rules  , the original or the exchange, when an exchange is ultimately refunded applies to air and non-air Order Reshop Cancel and Refund Exchanged on Host/Cancel Cancel Air after one Air Exchange and Cancel Air after Subsequent Air exchanges Cancel on host after exchanged - sync scenarios should cover this use case Cancel EMD-A, EMD-S after air exchange, Cancel EMD-A after subsequent EMD-A exchange JSON and NDC API

Anticipated or identified risks and dependencies

What are business risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are project risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are external dependencies?

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are technical/technology risk?

{Enter information here as applicable}

Team(s) Involved

Domain Team(s) Involved (Y or N) Offer -  Shopping Engine Offer - RMX Y Availability and Inventory Order Management/APIs and Plugin's (OMS) Y SabreMosaic UI ? Data Engineering and Science Y E2E QA Y Platform Team N SRE+ N

External Team(s) Involved

External Team (outside of SabreMosaic) Team(s) Involved (Y or N) OFS ? PostCalc ? Intellisell (Isell) ? Ancillaries (ANCS) ? Tax Team N Payments (SEPG) N Pricing ? PNR Services N Google N Radixx N UX N

Assumptions

We don’t expect any schema changes under JSON or XML/NDC SabreMosaic APIs.

We don’t expect any changes under OfferServicingService JSON schema.

We will not implement any rollback mechanism to previous order_item_1, and we will leave the order with unserviceable states that required Agent intervention.

Use cases like: cancel unpaid, void and cancel, void payment, will require agent intervention as we will not fully handle them by SabreMosaic.

Canceling air together with EMD-A and EMD-S items may cause ancillary items to be automatically cancelled by PSS or items will become OUT_OF_SYNC and ready to execute Cancel or Exchange by Sabre Mosaic.

Although we won’t change any SabreMosaic schemas, we will start populating new Reshop Responses in new way for many use cases.

Impacted components: RMX, OSS, OMS, OFS, DW, POS

Development with MVP mode with all corresponding disciplines.

Targeted carrier: Existing SabreMosaic customer JU and VA

Testing carrier: SabreMosaic (X0)



RMX development need to be secured by Feature Flag: FEA97211_CancelAfterExchange
reference: Wolverine Technology supports the goals of the SabreMosaic platform by proving that the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic is possible, which is a key objective for the program.

user_input: What is the high-level business need related to the cancellation options and how does it define success for the customer?
reference_contexts:
<1-hop>

High-level Business Need / Market Problems

What is the customer's high-level business need or market problem? (What are the drivers? Who exactly (persona) is affected by the problem? What is customer’s problem? Why is this a problem? How often do they face the problem? How much does the problem cost to customer? How does customer solve the problem today? Consequences of not solving the problem? What data supports/invalidates our assumptions and beliefs about problem?​) 

VA would like to have additional option "Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions" within the ticket Void Period (usually Void is allowed within 24h after ticketing)

Airline needs to have both options for the agent to either: void the ticket (their mistake) or cancel the ticket under the fare conditions (customers mistake)

 Objectives for a Successful Solution 

What objectives does the customer need to accomplish? (What is the customer’s goal(s)?)

[describe who the customers and end-users are (include partition and/or PCCs), what they want to accomplish] 

Within the Void period defined by airline, the OrderReShop Cancel should provide user the following options:

Cancel under Fare Rule Conditions (user's mistake) - enforcing the Refund during Void period

Void and Retain

Void and Refund (void and cancel order items)

NEW REQ flag: Return all cancel options 

  "request": {

        "updateOrder": {

            "cancelOrderId": "{{orderId}}"

        },

        "responseParameters": {

            "returnAllCancelOffers": true

Out of scope Cancel Option (already market ready):

Cancel Order and Maintain Value ( Air Items and Ancillaries, Seats in this FEA tbc) - RespendInd in IATA NDC schema

Nice to have, consistent naming in UI:



Cancel Options: Cancel Order and Payment (instead of Reservation and Payment) 

 Business Value  

What is the measurable benefit delivered? (What is the value of what we’re doing? What benefits user gets while using solution? How customer describes value? What is the value for customer? How the solution address the problem?​ Why do we decided to solve the problem?​ What is unique about our value proposition? How does it differentiate from existing solutions? Does this uniqueness matter to customers?)

[describe how end-users, customers and Sabre will benefit from the solution] 

Depending on use case, travel agencies will have flexibility in choosing Cancel or Void option, when Cancel request is within 24h from ticketing/order payment

<2-hop>

What Success Looks Like

What conditions must be met?  (What are the verifiable results? How do you define success of this capability?​ How to measure success?​ How customer measure success?​ How will it impact customer?​ What quantitative metrics can be used to measure value proposition?​)   

[describe what is essential to meet customer/user requirements, security, and expectations, how success will be measured, key performance indicators]  

Enter input here.

This capability will enable user to cancel air exchanged item and also corresponding ancillaries like: seat, bags and all other EMD-A items. Previously SabreMosaic cancel operation was limited to cancel initial air order and corresponding EMD-As, but now regardless of number of exchanges we will be able to cancel recent air exchanged order_item and also EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, that are not automatically canceled by PSS.

When an OrderItem is exchanged, and then ultimately refunded, the applicable refundability rules from the Original itinerary apply.

reference: The high-level business need related to the cancellation options is to provide users with the ability to cancel under fare rule conditions within the ticket void period, allowing flexibility for both user and agent mistakes. Success is defined by the ability to meet customer requirements, which includes providing measurable benefits such as protecting the airline from leakage by rule bypassing and ensuring that the most restrictive refundability rules apply when a changed order item is subsequently canceled.

These indicators help assess how effectively the solution addresses market problems, such as the need for flexibility in canceling or voiding tickets within the defined void period. By enabling users to choose between canceling under fare rule conditions or voiding tickets, the solution aims to enhance customer service and operational efficiency, ultimately delivering measurable business value.

reference: The objectives associated with implementing the 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' option for travel agencies include providing users with flexibility in choosing between canceling under fare conditions or voiding a ticket within the defined void period. This allows agents to handle customer mistakes effectively while enforcing refunds during the void period. The business value delivered by this solution is significant, as it enhances the user experience by offering multiple cancel options, thereby addressing the high-level business need of flexibility in ticket management. Success metrics for this capability include the application of the most restrictive refundability rules when a changed order item is subsequently canceled, which ensures that the solution meets customer expectations and operational goals.

Although we won’t change any SabreMosaic schemas, we will start populating new Reshop Responses in new way for many use cases.

Impacted components: RMX, OSS, OMS, OFS, DW, POS

Development with MVP mode with all corresponding disciplines.

Targeted carrier: Existing SabreMosaic customer JU and VA

Testing carrier: SabreMosaic (X0)



RMX development need to be secured by Feature Flag: FEA97211_CancelAfterExchange
reference: The implementation of the 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' option enhances flexibility for travel agencies by allowing agents to choose between voiding a ticket due to their mistake or canceling it under fare conditions when the customer makes a mistake. This capability is particularly beneficial within the void period defined by the airline, as it provides users with multiple options: canceling under fare rules, voiding and retaining the ticket, or voiding and refunding the ticket. This flexibility helps travel agencies better manage cancellations and improve customer service.
